subject: Re: [junit] Running same tests again with different configuration..
msgSnippet: ... ??? The original poster wants to run the same set of tests against different implementations. I assume the different implementations are somehow related,
messageBody:
On Monday 09 May 2005 18:54, Cedric Beust wrote:
> > On Monday 09 May 2005 13:35, Arun J wrote:
> > > I wanted to run the same set of tests with different underlying
> > > Implementation. Is there a ready mix available for this purpose?
> >
> > Try inheritance, e.g. an abstract test case.
> > http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?AbstractTestCases
>
> I don't think AbstractTestCase helps in this case (it's orthogonal to
> the question, actually).
???

The original poster wants to run the same set of tests against different
implementations.

I assume the different implementations are somehow related, e.g. share a
common base class or implement a common interface.

From the cited web page:
"An Abstract TestCase ... that ensures that ... implementations of the ...
class behave as expected."

This is not orthogonal, this is exactly what is needed.

> The problem is passing different strategies to the same test class and
> running your tests on all the different instances of that class (which
> can therefore not use statics to maintain its state).
I don't understand what you mean by the statics and state.
Otherwise this is what an abstract test case does.

What am I missing here?

Robert
